name: Birch Biosciences
headline: We recycle plastic using engineered enzymes
description: Birch Biosciences engineers enzymes for plastic recycling using synthetic biology and machine learning.  Our enzymes function as high performance “molecular scissors” that efficiently break down plastic polymers into chemical building blocks that can be used to manufacture high quality recycled plastic products.   Today, plastic manufacturing  is unsustainable and a major driver of climate change.   Birch Biosciences is developing an economical end-to-end plastic recycling process that reduces carbon emissions by 70% and enables a circular plastic economy.

founders.name: Johan Kers, Founder
founders.description: Johan is co-founder and Chief Executive Officer of Birch Biosciences.  He has spent the last 15 years programming bacteria and genetic circuits to produce novel therapeutic proteins and other natural products at leading companies including Absci and Ginkgo Bioworks.  Johan is especially interested in solving major sustainability problems using biotechnology.   He holds a PhD from Cornell University and completed a postdoctoral fellowship at Stanford University School of Medicine.

# We Are Revolutionizing Plastic Recycling
We are an AI native company developing engineered enzymes that act as ‘molecular scissors” to recycle plastic, enabling manufacture of economical, 100% recycled plastic products in a circular economy.
[Contact Us](http://www.birchbiosciences.com/<#>)
# We Are Revolutionizing Plastic Recycling
Birch Biosciences is developing novel plastic recycling technologies using generative AI and advanced enzyme engineering to bring plastics into the circular economy.
[Contact Us](http://www.birchbiosciences.com/</contact-us>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66fef868876d4be6ab2c9127_100%25%20RECYCLED%20CONTENT%20\(12\).png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66fef868876d4be6ab2c9127_100%25%20RECYCLED%20CONTENT%20\(12\).png)
## 9% Of Plastic Is Recycled.We’re Fixing That.
The 9% US plastic recycling rate hasn’t improved in 15 years. Most recycled plastic is lower quality and higher cost than virgin plastic manufactured from fossil fuels. Today, manufacturing new plastic is responsible for 7% of global carbon emissions.
[Learn moreabout us](http://www.birchbiosciences.com/</about-us>)
[Our technology](http://www.birchbiosciences.com/</our-science>)
OUR TECHNOLOGY
## The _Science_ Behind Enzymatic Recycling
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66edede714babca60bc8b034_Add%20a%20heading%20\(1\).svg)
We use generative AI and proprietary high-throughput screening techniques to redesign enzymes with transformational recycling properties. These high-performance enzymes are integrated into a proprietary recycling process that breaks down plastic polymers, enabling the production of 100% recycled content plastics. This eliminates the need for fossil fuels in plastic manufacturing.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66e1ffe3ce47f3222fbc3eb1_Untitled%20design%20\(1\).svg)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66d8930d93d028fbdeba83f6_2.svg)![icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66a75f8551b1772080c05b6e_Frame%2067-1.svg)
# High Quality
# Low Emissions
# Better Economics
Enzymatically recycled plastic matches the quality of new plastic manufactured from fossil fuels
Greenhouse gas emissions for plastic manufacturing are reduced >70%
Improved process economics enable competitive pricing of high quality enzymatically recycled plastic
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66e1ffe3ce47f3222fbc3eb1_Untitled%20design%20\(1\).svg)
# High Quality
Enzymatically recycled plastic matches the quality of new plastic manufactured from fossil fuels
![icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66a75f8551b1772080c05b6e_Frame%2067-1.svg)
# Low Emissions
Enzymatically recycled plastic Greenhouse gas emissions for plastic manufacturing are reduced >70%
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66e1ffe3ce47f3222fbc3eb1_Untitled%20design%20\(1\).svg)
# Better Economics
Improved process economics enable competitive pricing of high quality enzymatically recycled plastic
HOW IT WORKS
### Our Enzymatic Recycling Process
Bottles, clamshells, and polyester textiles are shredded to small particle sizes
Enzymes break down plastic polymers into chemical monomers by breaking chemical bonds
100% recycled plastic resin is used to manufacture high quality plastic products
Chemical monomers are repolymerized into 100% recycled plastic resin

## Meet Our Leadership Team
Birch Biosciences is led by an experienced team of innovators dedicated to advancing novel biotechnologies that enable plastics to enter the circular economy.
[Get to know us](http://www.birchbiosciences.com/</about-us>)

## Latest News
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66fdda452e39d056b8530aac_USE%20\(1\).svg)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66f2fbb99dc91282a090c656_Untitled%20\(2081%20x%201335%20px\)%20\(1\).png)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/675c8777fbcb3b73301da52f_USE.png)
###### Birch Biosciences Awarded NSF SBIR Phase II
###### Senator Merkley visits Birch Biosciences
###### DARPA BTO award to advance AI for enzyme engineering
We are proud to announce that Birch Biosciences has been awarded a prestigious NSF SBIR Phase II Award! This $1 million grant supports the advancement of enzymatic recycling technology so we can make a lasting impact on sustainable solutions.
Birch Biosciences hosted US Senator Jeff Merkley at our laboratory. Sen. Merkley is a leading advocate for plastic recycling and reduction of the impact of plastics on our environment. It will take a village to solve this problem, and we're grateful for federal support to help bring plastic into the circular economy!
Birch Biosciences is honored to announce an award to advance AI-driven enzyme design for plastic recycling in partnership with the DARPA Biological Technologies Office. The award will further the development of Birch’s AI technologies for recycling across a range of plastic types.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66fdda452e39d056b8530aac_USE%20\(1\).svg)
###### Birch Biosciences Awarded NSF SBIR Phase II
We are proud to announce that Birch Biosciences has been awarded a prestigious NSF SBIR Phase II Award! This $1 million grant supports the advancement of enzymatic recycling technology so we can make a lasting impact on sustainable solutions.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66f2fbb99dc91282a090c656_Untitled%20\(2081%20x%201335%20px\)%20\(1\).png)
###### Senator Merkley visits Birch Biosciences
Birch Biosciences hosted US Senator Jeff Merkley at our laboratory. Sen. Merkley is a leading advocate for plastic recycling and reduction of the impact of plastics on our environment. It will take a village to solve this problem, and we're grateful for federal support to help bring plastic into the circular economy!
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66fed2dca17b8da74ca92f01_USED%20-%20BLOG.png)
###### DOE SBIR Phase II Award Recipient
We're excited to share that Birch Biosciences has been awarded a DOE SBIR Phase II grant to focus on polyurethane, a significant endorsement of our mission to drive innovation in enzymatic recycling and sustainable biomanufacturing.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66a8cfffe6ef73e7856f4b96_Ellipse%20432.svg)
## Let's build a better _future_ together
We believe that collaboration and community are key to driving meaningful innovation. We partner with businesses, government agencies, and universities to accelerate innovation and commercialization of recycling technologies.
[Contact Us](http://www.birchbiosciences.com/</contact-us>)

## Meet Our Leadership Team
Birch Biosciences is led by an experienced team of innovators dedicated to advancing novel biotechnologies that enable plastics to enter the circular economy.
Get to know us⟨2⟩
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/670d6f350364f94e4dc97fdf_Untitled%20design%20\(38\).png)

## Latest News
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66fdda452e39d056b8530aac_USE%20\(1\).svg)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66f2fbb99dc91282a090c656_Untitled%20\(2081%20x%201335%20px\)%20\(1\).png)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/675c8777fbcb3b73301da52f_USE.png)
###### Birch Biosciences Awarded NSF SBIR Phase II
###### Senator Merkley visits Birch Biosciences
###### DARPA BTO award to advance AI for enzyme engineering
We are proud to announce that Birch Biosciences has been awarded a prestigious NSF SBIR Phase II Award! This $1 million grant supports the advancement of enzymatic recycling technology so we can make a lasting impact on sustainable solutions.
Birch Biosciences hosted US Senator Jeff Merkley at our laboratory. Sen. Merkley is a leading advocate for plastic recycling and reduction of the impact of plastics on our environment. It will take a village to solve this problem, and we're grateful for federal support to help bring plastic into the circular economy!
Birch Biosciences is honored to announce an award to advance AI-driven enzyme design for plastic recycling in partnership with the DARPA Biological Technologies Office. The award will further the development of Birch’s AI technologies for recycling across a range of plastic types.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66fdda452e39d056b8530aac_USE%20\(1\).svg)
###### Birch Biosciences Awarded NSF SBIR Phase II
We are proud to announce that Birch Biosciences has been awarded a prestigious NSF SBIR Phase II Award! This $1 million grant supports the advancement of enzymatic recycling technology so we can make a lasting impact on sustainable solutions.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66f2fbb99dc91282a090c656_Untitled%20\(2081%20x%201335%20px\)%20\(1\).png)
###### Senator Merkley visits Birch Biosciences
Birch Biosciences hosted US Senator Jeff Merkley at our laboratory. Sen. Merkley is a leading advocate for plastic recycling and reduction of the impact of plastics on our environment. It will take a village to solve this problem, and we're grateful for federal support to help bring plastic into the circular economy!
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66fed2dca17b8da74ca92f01_USED%20-%20BLOG.png)
###### DOE SBIR Phase II Award Recipient
We're excited to share that Birch Biosciences has been awarded a DOE SBIR Phase II grant to focus on polyurethane, a significant endorsement of our mission to drive innovation in enzymatic recycling and sustainable biomanufacturing.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66a748f5a17fe4f7ee0bce26/66a8cfffe6ef73e7856f4b96_Ellipse%20432.svg)
## Let's build a better _future_ together
We believe that collaboration and community are key to driving meaningful innovation. We partner with businesses, government agencies, and universities to accelerate innovation and commercialization of recycling technologies.

generated_description:
### Birch Biosciences Overview

**Mission**: Birch Biosciences is on a mission to revolutionize plastic recycling through innovative enzyme technology. By harnessing the power of engineered enzymes, they recycle plastics into valuable raw materials, fostering a circular economy.

**What They Do**: The company, founded in 2021 and part of Y Combinator's Batch S22, leverages synthetic biology and machine learning to create specialized enzymes that act like "molecular scissors." These enzymes effectively break down plastic polymers into chemical building blocks, which can then be used to produce high-quality recycled plastic products. This not only enhances the quality of recycled materials but also significantly reduces carbon emissions—by approximately 70%—compared to traditional plastic manufacturing methods.

**Location and Team**: Based in Portland, Oregon, Birch Biosciences operates with a dedicated team of ten employees, partnering with organizations like Nan in their journey towards sustainability.

**The Problem They're Solving**: In an age where only 9% of plastics are recycled, Birch targets the inefficiencies of existing recycling methods. Currently, most recycled plastics are of inferior quality and cost more than virgin materials derived from fossil fuels. By developing a reliable, cost-effective recycling process, Birch aims to create a sustainable solution to the plastic crisis and combat climate change.

**Technology**: Birch's recycling approach utilizes generative AI to enhance the performance of their enzymes, allowing for the transformation of plastic waste into new resources without the need for fossil fuels. This process not only matches the quality of newly manufactured plastics but also makes recycling economically viable.

**Recent Achievements**: Birch Biosciences has garnered attention for its innovative work, recently securing a $1 million NSF SBIR Phase II award to further advance its enzymatic recycling technology. They also received recognition from DARPA for their efforts in AI-driven enzyme engineering.

**Tags**: The company's focus areas include machine learning, synthetic biology, biotech, climate solutions, and climate technology.

**Website**: For more information, you can visit their official site at [www.birchbiosciences.com](http://www.birchbiosciences.com).

In essence, Birch Biosciences is not just innovating in the biotech space; it is charting a path towards a more sustainable future by redefining how we think about and manage plastic waste.
